Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the unemployment rate in Elizabeth by stating that it is the lowest of all the big cities in New Jersey, while in reality, it is the third lowest.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Jersey City has a lower unemployment rate than Elizabeth.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any data or evidence to support the statement that Elizabeth has the lowest unemployment rate among big cities in New Jersey.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that being the city with the lowest unemployment rate is a positive indicator of success without considering other factors.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the claim, as the city spokesman clarified that Bollwage meant to say Elizabeth has one of the lowest, not the lowest, unemployment rates among New Jersey's most populous cities.
